Package sprouts

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Action<D>
    Implementations of this are conceptually similar to listeners, observers or any kind of event handler usually triggered by UI components or properties to cause some sort of binding effect.
    Observable
    This represents an occurrence that can be observed but not triggered.
    Observer
    A listener is a callback that is executed when a sprouts Observable is triggered usually in the form of an Occurrence or property, like Val, Var, Vals or Vars.
    Occurrence
    This represents an occurrence that can be observed as well as triggered.
    Occurrence.Executor
    The "occurrence executor" is responsible for executing a given Runnable when an Occurrence is triggered.
    Problem
    A problem is a wrapper for information describing an issue that can be reported and attached to a Result.
    Result<V>
    A result is very similar to an Optional in that it can either contain a value or not, with the difference being that a result can also contain a list of Problems which describe what went wrong in the process of obtaining the value wrapped by the result.
    Val<T>
    A read only view on an item which can be observed by any kind of frontend so that it can be notified and updated when the item changes.
    Vals<T>
    An immutable view of a list of immutably viewed properties that can be observed, iterated over, mapped, filtered, turned into a stream, and more.
    ValsDelegate<T>
    A context object passed to the various types of change listeners registered in property lists such as Vals and Vars.
    Var<T>
    A mutable wrapper for an item which can be observed by the frontend (or other application layers) to then dynamically update itself for you, as well as trigger a possible change action inside your view model.
    Vars<T>
    A list of mutable properties that can be observed for changes.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    Change
    Describes how a Vars instance was mutated.
